metaDescription: Start your yoga journey with us. Everything you need to know to get started with yoga - from what to wear to which classes suit beginners.
title: Welcome Beginners
subtitle: Your yoga journey begins here - we'll guide you every step of the way

intro.title: Yoga is for everyone
intro.description: Regardless of age, fitness level or previous experience - yoga adapts to you. With us, you'll meet experienced teachers who safely guide you through every step of your yoga journey.

firstClass.title: Your first class
firstClass.description: Arrive 15 minutes early to register and familiarize yourself with the studio. The teacher will welcome you and ask about any injuries or limitations.

during.title: During class
during.description: The teacher guides you through each position and offers alternatives that suit your level. Listen to your body and take breaks when needed.

after.title: After class
after.description: Take time to notice how you feel. Drink water and enjoy the feeling of calm and presence.

whatToBring.title: What you need
items: Comfortable clothes you can move freely in
Small towel (if you get warm easily)
Your own yoga mat (we have mats to borrow)

tips.title: Tips for beginners
items: Don't eat a large meal 2 hours before class
Come with an open mind and no expectations
Tell the teacher it's your first time
It's okay not to master all positions right away

recommendedClasses.title: Recommended classes for beginners
recommendedClasses.description: These classes are particularly suitable if you're new to yoga:

hatha.title: Hatha Yoga
hatha.description: Slow pace focusing on basic positions and breathing. Perfect for learning the fundamentals.

yinYoga.title: Yin Yoga
yinYoga.description: Gentle and relaxing yoga where positions are held longer. Increases flexibility and inner calm.

beginnerFlow.title: Beginner Flow
beginnerFlow.description: A gentle introduction to dynamic yoga with simple flows and lots of guidance.

flexibility.question: Do I need to be flexible to do yoga?
flexibility.answer: Absolutely not! Yoga is about meeting your body where it is today. Flexibility comes with time.

comparison.question: Will others judge me?
comparison.answer: Everyone is focused on their own practice. Our community is warm and welcoming - we've all been beginners.

frequency.question: How often should I practice yoga as a beginner?
frequency.answer: Start with 1-2 times per week and gradually increase. Listen to your body and find your own rhythm.

testimonial.text: I was nervous before my first class, but the teacher was so welcoming and helpful. Now, a year later, I can't imagine my life without yoga.
testimonial.author: Maria, member since 2022

cta.title: Ready to start?
cta.description: Take the first step on your yoga journey today. We're here to support you all the way.

trialOffer.title: Special offer for new yogis
trialOffer.details: Valid for 2 weeks from first class
